intro: Cyanthillium cinereum var. montanum, commonly known as the mountain blueweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils in open, rocky habitats. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, often with a bluish-gray hue, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
